en: Graduate in software engineering from the École de Technologie Supérieure of Montreal in 2007, Mr. Brouillard is a solution architect, accomplished developer and team lead who cumulates nearly 10 years of hands-on experience on several projects such as web applications, mobile apps and xClient apps on the .Net platform and backend integrations. Mr. Brouillard is also training as a Professional SCRUM Master. On his latest mandates he has leveraged technologies such as .NET 4.5, C#, Angular JS, NodeJS, HTML5, CSS3, IOS Swift, Azure PaaS and SaaS, ASP.Net MVC5, WPF, WCF. Worked with various clients from Montreal to Sacramento through Winnipeg and led development teams located in India.

At CGI, Mr. Brouillard is establishing the mobility expertise for CGI’s excellence centers in Sherbrooke and Shawinigan. This mandate involves establishing practices and designs, lead projects, hiring talents, establishing relationships with clients and mentoring to consultants.

school.en: École de Technologie Supérieure, Montréal, Quebec, Canada
school.fr: École de Technologie Supérieure, Montréal, Quebec, Canada

school.en: CÉGEP Granby Haute-Yamaska, Granby, Quebec, Canada
school.fr: CÉGEP Granby Haute-Yamaska, Granby, Quebec, Canada

project.fr: Centre de livraison Sherbrooke et Shawinigan

description.en: For CGI at Sherbrooke and Shawinigan Center of Excellence Mr. Brouillard is in charge of leading and establishing the mobility expertise in order to attract projects and maintenance contracts of diverse mobile applications and systems. On this mandate, Mr. Brouillard has the tasks:

tasks.en: Establish guidance and practices in mobile development, design, analysis and quality assurance;
Lead hiring interviews and contacting talents;
Communicate on a daily basis with clients and CGI Montreal Mobility Center of Excellence in order to position the delivery centers;
Establish formation programs and select training material;
Meet clients and establish contacts;
Support RFP process;
Develop toolkits and accelerators;

name.en: VS2015 TACO Angular on Cordova Bootstrap
name.fr: VS2015 TACO Angular on Cordova Bootstrap

description.en: A simple nuget package for Visual Studio which lets developers get a head start on developing AngularJS apps on Apache Cordova.

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For Quest and its client, Spectocor Medical Supplies, the consultant has been in charge of developing the front end components for a report downloader solution. The project has been developed using Agile methodologies. The application is a Windows Forms app with its runtime services layer. The Frontend and Runtime components run independently and communicates through local named pipes. On this mandate Mr. Brouillard was in charge of:

tasks.en: Design the application structure and validate solution technically;
Develop the Winforms application;
Design the UX in line with the client’s branding;
Design and develop the runtime layer;
Design the Windows Service headless printing solution;

project.fr: Preuve de concept pour client confidentiel

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For Morneau Shepell and CGI on a joint participation to a RFP, Mr. Brouillard was in charge of developing a high quality with appealing UX an AngularJS based web application. The application integrated two complex user data entry scenarios and the development duration spanned over a two weeks’ period. The application integrated with Microsoft SSIS. On this mandate Mr. Brouillard was in charge of:

tasks.en: Develop the AngularJS web application;
Design the UX in line with the minister’s branding;
Design the asynchronous SSIS integration mechanisms;
Integrate SignalR job progress reporting hooks;

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For the Johnston Group in a Kony based mobile application phase 2 development project, Mr. Brouillard is in charge of maintaining the communication between the development team in India, the project management based in Edmonton and the client in Winnipeg. The project is an evolution which adds features to an existing application on mobile web, iOS and Android. On this mandate Mr. Brouillard is responsible for:

tasks.en: Do final QA and delivering the apps to the client;
Manage in ItunesConnect and Google PlayStore MyBenefits application;
Mediating between the client and the development team in order to meet the client’s requirements;
Managing development platform provider relationship;

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For the development of a data capture mobile application for the oil and gas industry the objective was to develop a brand new application on both WinRT platforms and Windows WPF using a reusable code base. Mr. Brouillard on this position was in charge of the solutions design, technical analysis and lead of a team of 5 developers. This project spanned on multiple sites from Montreal, Calgary and Bangalore. As highlights, the application had to allow a disconnected operation model, a scriptable business rule engine and a UIx consistent between the mobile and classic modes. On this mandate, Mr. Brouillard had to:

tasks.en: Design visual models and user experience (UX);
Design the solution to minimize the WPF development tasks and by using the WinRT MVVM Framework Caliburn.Micro;
Develop the solution to support the offline mode and a dynamic configurable business rules engine;
Develop training material for developers;
Establish a development recipe and practices to be adopted;
Lead a development team and perform quality assurance tasks;
Manage customer expectations in terms of technical challenges;
Develop components TDD and write unit tests;
Actively participate in daily monitoring activities;
Apply established standards development;
Carry out inspections and code reviews;

project.en: Windows Store Offer, Mobile App Fabric
project.fr: Windows Store Offer, Mobile App Fabric

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: As head of the Windows Store service offering Microsoft CGI Expertise Center, Mr. Brouillard is in charge of developing strategies and tools to position the CoE in this growing market. A mandate that has been entrusted to Mr. Brouillard is to develop a reusable application that maximizes the machine base of T4 templating Microsoft in order to obtain a platform that reduces costs of Windows Store application development. In this position, Mr. Brouillard has completed the following tasks:

tasks.en: Analyze tendering and estimating projects;
Provide training materials and create a core of developers;
Perform technology watch;
Design visual models and user experience (UX);
Design a project template that will generate Windows Phone, Windows Store and WPF applications simultaneously;
Design and develop the project and the components required for an application of 'Line of Business';
Create T4 templates to generate code from an external data source (SQL, WebAPI);
Develop and write unit tests;

description.en: As a senior developer assigned to the Prim’Heure project, Mr. Brouillard is responsible for the development of key functional components. This application manages the schedule of employees and workstations at four Casinos of Lotto-Quebec sites. This application requires the development of components using GDI+. This task requires strong knowledge of Windows Forms and .Net framework foundations. In this role, he executed the following activities:

tasks.en: Based on functional requirements documentation, detailing tasks, estimates and and designs of the technical solution elements required to develop the components to meet the functional requirements;
Developing and improving the applications infrastructure that integrated the functional units, which posed several challenges, required a long term project vision and risk management strategies;
Developing screens and forms using Windows Forms, GDI+ and the Infragistics controls;

Performing inspections and code reviews; developing optimization strategies with the client in order to reduce the screens complexity while maintaining users’ functional goals; managing the documentation and updates to functional unit documents;
Manage source control and build delivery;
Write technical documentation;

description.en: As an Analyst / .NET Developer, Mr. Brouillard was in charge of developing a .Net WinForms-based simulator of an HydroQuebec grid off-loader. The system needed to operate with near real time performance while simulating up to 48 off-loaders concurrently. The goal was to use this software as a tool to test the next generation of HydroQuebec Network Management System (CADRE). The system uses a new network protocol (DNP/IP) which is developed by a third party specifically for this system. On this assignment, his principal tasks were:

tasks.en: Extracting from technical specifications of the original hardware equipment requirements for the simulator and write tests cases accordingly;

Based on a prototype built beforehand, improving the user interface and rewriting WinForms user controls. Using NUnit and NMock in a TDD fashion, proceeding to development of the simulator to reflect extracted requirements. Implementing mocks to supplement third-party components not yet available. Implementing a rich scripting environment that provides the end user a convenient way to simulate events inside the simulator;
Writing unit tests to prove correctness of implementation. Creating application profiling scenarios to evaluate actual performances and detecting improvement areas;
Managing third-party deliverables and milestones while keeping change requests at the lowest number possible;

description.en: This mandate consisted of developing the updated compensation program used by BRP. The project involved the use of SQL Server SSIS 2005 to extract, manipulate, calculate and store values as required to produce accurate reports in MS Excel and within BRP BOSSWeb. This project required the use of ASP.Net 2.0, Ajax Control Toolkit, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services, Microsoft SQL Server and Mercury Quality Center. He carried out the following tasks:

tasks.en: Implementing, modifying and correcting new reports built as ASP.Net 2.0 Web forms, implementing and modifying specific SSIS data flows, implementing and modifying specific stored procedures, implementing specific MS Excel macros for cross validation;
Drafting and executing unit tests to ensure quality control throughout the report development phase using NUnit and NMock;
Drafting and executing functional and integrated tests using Mercury Quality Center and Team Foundation Server as a work item tracking system;
Source control management;

mandates.client: Ministère de la Justice du Québec

description.en: This mandate consisted of migrating the existing VB6 FormulRDPRM application to an ASP.NET Web application on service-oriented architecture. The solution was used by clients of the Ministère de la justice du Québec wishing to register personal and real rights in the RDPRM registry. His tasks included the following:

tasks.en: Developing Web Forms using ASP.Net 2.0 and the Ajax Control Toolkit. Constructing WebControls to attain maintainability and reusability objectives and extending the behaviour of numerous Ajax controls;
Performing unit tests using NUnit and performing integration tests;
Applying strict coding standards guided by the use of tools such as the code analysis provided with Visual Studio .NET 2005;
Source control management;

description.en: The BRP BOSSWeb project consisted of reengineering a CRM application built originally with ASP, SQL Server 2000 and SAP R3. The objectives of this reengineering were to provide the customer with the same features on a rewritten system in ASP.Net 2.0 and Ajax, SQL Server, Microsoft Office SharePoint Services, SAP XI, AndroMda for the code generation and TeamFoundation Server. On this particular assignment, his tasks included the following:

tasks.en: Developing bottom-up functional deliverables using the .NET 2.0 framework;
Developing ASP.NET WebForms according to requirements. Improving behaviours by integrating the Ajax Toolkit;
Updating the software models generated with Rational Software Modeler. Refactoring and extending existing models;
Building the code generation process using AndroMDA. Developing code templates expressing the architecture correctly, integrating the code generation process within the build environment;
Constructing XSL transformations for messages exchanged between BOSSWeb and SAP XI. Integrating SAP R3 functions within SAP XI;

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For the Cirque du Soleil at the International Headquarters, among a team of three developers, Mr. Brouillard is in charge of the solutions architecture and the development of the 2015 phase of the COSA (Cirque Oriented Service Architecture) platform. This project contains several aspects such as the Azure automated deployment platform design and development and the development of new enterprise services. On this mandate, the tasks of Etienne Brouillard are:

tasks.en: Design and document the automated deployment process on Azure;
Develop PowerShell modules;
Integrate the Azure Resource Management in the tooling;
Design and document master data enterprise services (clients and sales);
Develop, integrate and deploy master data enterprise services;

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For the Cirque du Soleil at the International Headquarters, among a team of five developers and as an introductory project, Mr. Brouillard was in charge of the integration using ASP.Net MVC of the new show’s microsite Toruk – The First Flight. At this position, Mr. Brouillard has quickly taken leadership on the microsite integration on the current azure WebApp. The tasks on this mandate consisted of:

tasks.en: Develop the Toruk microsite using ASP.Net MVC 5, C# and JavaScript;
Develop the microsite automated deployment strategy on Azure;

role.fr: Architecte de Solution et Développeur principal

description.en: For the Cashtrak NG project, Mr. Brouillard was in charge for the delivery of the technological platform. This platform aims at implement a brand new Azure platform for the cash in transit management system used by GardaWorld. The system consists in several key integration points, several performance key points, a new SPA application template and REST Services hardened to meet high security requirements. All this solely relying on Microsoft Azure PaaS’ and SaaS' in order to reduce to its minimum operation costs and leverages Azure’s great availability record. On this mandate Mr. Brouillard was in charge of:

tasks.en: Design the application development platform for the SPA HTML5 app and REST web services using C#, .Net, AngularJS, Azure PaaS and SaaS;
Design the solutions architecture around data access, business rules and legacy systems integrations (ftp, file share, SOAP);
Design the security architecture around Azure Active Directory and nTiers systems;
Create project templates on Visual Studio;
Manage SDLC tooling such as continuous integration and automated testing;
Manage development teams at the architecture level;

description.en: For TechSolCom Inc, Mr. Brouillard has driven Microsoft focused development center of expertise. The orientation of the company is to become a leader in Microsoft and Azure applications solutions development. Moreover, the goal is to leverage the skillset acquired on the Java side of the center to quickly make this development center shine. The existing centers skillsets includes SCRUM and Atlassian. The center used the Cashtrak project with Garda as a first significant milestone. The main objectives were:

tasks.en: Establish and obtain the centers development competency silver certification and then move forward toward obtaining the Gold level. ;
Manage developer’s certifications and trainings paths;
Recruit skilled resources to deliver Garda and Faurecia projects;
Provide tools and guidance to developers;
Setup Azure enterprise agreement between Microsoft and TechSolCom inc;
Start establishing proper SDLC practices;
Participate to project costing and sizing for proposals;

description.en: As the founder of Robots & Fruits and initiator of LabRadar, Mr Brouillard is in charge of designing the system solution, develop the initial beta and setting up the company. LabRadar aims at providing a powerful content aggregation system using Azure as a cloud environment. The application is being developped by a small team led by Mr. Brouillard. On this endeavour, Mr. Brouillard has these responsibilities:

tasks.en: Designing the systen solution around Azure;
Develop application modules and features which fulfil initial feature goals;
Manage SDLC and DevOps;
Manage an init of an enterprise and prepare business plan for founding round;

project.en: ECOBOM (Engineering Change Order / Bill Of Material)
project.fr: ECOBOM (Engineering Change Order / Bill Of Material)

description.en: As a senior developer, Mr. Brouillard was in charge of developing and maintaining an application managing parts engineering change orders for Renault F1 race cars. The process ultimately allowed releasing, within the shortest timeframe possible, parts for a specific car following the part design cycle. As the main developer on the project, he had travel often to Enstone, UK to meet with the team, project managers, client and business analysts. The task at hand was to rebuild, nearly from the ground up, core components of the system to improve its maintainability, evolutivity and overall quality. His tasks included:

tasks.en: From the existing solution, extracting business modules and redefining logical layers; analyzing the structure, proposing rebuilding strategies, presenting structured risk and feasibility analysis and determining project scope;
Defining a software development process and tools to use; training team and ensuring that the clients expectations are in line with the planning;
Executing the rework, integrating change and evolution requests and assigning tasks to the development team;
Defining the code generation process using MyGeneration which produces from database tables Stored Procedures and CRUD C# code;
Write relevant technical documentation;
